str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to stop, i.e. Restrain, quit, desist, come to an end.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From epi and anago; to lead up on, i.e. to put out; to return.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From the same as bathus; profundity, i.e. extent; mystery.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To let down, lower, slacken, loosen. From the base of chasma; to lower.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A fishing-net. Probably from a primary verb diko; a seine.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Catching, a catch. From ago; a catching; also a haul.
